results.justification: The paper explicitly states its methodology, focusing on a deductive and inductive coding process of LA research papers. "Following the coding process used by [28] the two authors discussed (1) how each one would approach the deductive and inductive analysis..."

The paper provides a detailed, step-by-step description of the research design, including the selection of papers, the coding process, inter-rater reliability checks, and the analysis phases. "We firstly provide a brief problem statement...This is followed by a literature review...We then provide an overview of our methodology, followed by the analysis and discussion."
The paper provides a link to the working sheets: "We have also made available the working sheets in this link: https://kortlink.dk/2qx3t"

The coding heuristic is described in detail, functioning as a form of data documentation. "(1) Limitation is mentioned in the literature review; (2) limitation is mentioned in the discussion of the results; (3) the research design (quantitative, qualitative, mixed)..."

The data collection methods are fully described, detailing the selection criteria for the papers analyzed (LAK '22, '23, '24 conferences) and the exclusion criteria. "Following the coding process used by [28]...The corpus for analysis included154 of articles from LAK ’24, LAK ’23, and LAK ’22, of which10 papers were excluded..."
The paper does not mention sharing the analysis code (e.g., Python, R) in a repository.
Since the analysis code is not shared, there are no scripts for data cleaning, analysis, or visualization included.

The paper reports Fleiss’ kappa values to assess inter-rater reliability, a statistical measure. "The final kappa when comparing the results of the coding authors indicated a good level of agreement (^ = 0.76, subjects=154, raters= 2, andp <0.005) with low measure of controversy."

The paper describes a thematic analysis of the limitations sections, indicating a qualitative approach to interpreting the data. "Once again, the coding and theming process was informed by [28]. Both researchers coded the limitations’ section with specific attention to how authors suggested addressing the limitations’ sections, after which the differences in coding were discussed and resolved and collectively themed."
The paper does not contain a link to a preregistration.

The paper presents the categorization of papers based on their discussion of limitations and generalizability (Table 1) and the themes extracted from the analysis (Table 2)."As can be seen in the above table (Table 1),44% (n= 64) of the papers were found to fall inCategory 4..."

The paper explicitly discusses limitations, including the scope of the selection (only LAK conferences) and potential biases. "Our paper on examining the lack of generalisability in LA research has certain limitations...We assumed that the last three years’ proceedings from the LAK conference reflect the maturity of the field."
